s-1.ptxt: REMOVE TRANSMISSION CONTROL SHAFT LEVER LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut, spring washer and control shaft lever.
Using a screwdriver, bend the tabs of the lock washer.
Remove the nut and lock washer.
Remove the bolt and switch.
Remove the bolt and sensor.
Remove the 2 tube unions.
Remove the O-ring from each tube union.
Remove the bolt and sensor.
Remove the O-ring from the sensor.
Remove the bolt and sensor.
Remove the O-ring from the sensor.
Remove the bolt and sensor.
Remove the O-ring from the sensor.
Remove the 7 bolts.
Using SST, remove the oil pump.

s3.ptxt: Grasp the front pump stator shaft and pull the pump from the transmission case.

atten3.ptxt: Do not damage the stator shaft bushing surface.

s2.ptxt: Remove the bearing from the oil pump.
Remove the O-ring from the oil pump.
Remove the 6 bolts and transmission housing.
Remove the O-ring from the overdrive brake.
Remove the 6 bolts.
Remove the extension housing and gasket.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE EXTENSION HOUSING BUSH APPLY TUBE

s2.ptxt: Remove the gasket and tube from the extension housing.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION EXTENSION HOUSING OIL SEAL

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, pry out the retainer and dust seal.
Using a screwdriver, pry out the oil seal.
Mount the extension housing in a vise.
Using a screwdriver and hammer, tap off the dust deflector.
Using a cylinder gauge, measure the inside diameter of the extension housing bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the extension housing.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the rear side snap ring.
Remove the sensor rotor and key.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the front side snap ring.
Remove the 3 screws.
Remove the transmission case rear cover and gasket.
Install the transmission case to an overhaul attachment.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION OIL PAN SUB-ASSEMBLY

atten3.ptxt: Do not turn the transmission over as foreign matter in the bottom of the pan contaminates the valve body.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 14 bolts.
Remove the pan from the transmission case.
Remove the oil pan gasket.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION OIL PAN SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove all the magnets and use them to collect steel particles. Carefully look at the foreign matter and particles in the pan and on the magnets to determine the type of wear you will find in the transmission.
Steel (magnetic): bearing, gear and clutch plate wear
Brass (non-magnetic): bush wear

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE VALVE BODY OIL STRAINER ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the 3 bolts and oil strainer.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful as some fluid will leak out of the oil strainer.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 3 gaskets from the oil strainer.
Pry out both overdrive brake tube ends with a large screwdriver and remove the overdrive brake tube.
Disconnect the 4 shift solenoid valve connectors.
Remove the bolt and clamp.
Remove the bolt.
Pull out the transmission wire from the transmission case to remove it.
Remove the 17 bolts and valve body.
Position a cloth to catch each piston.
Apply compressed air to the oil holes shown, and remove the 3 pistons and 3 springs.
Remove the 2 O-rings from each piston.
Remove the 2 bolts, 2 wave washers and bracket.
Disconnect the parking lock rod from the manual valve lever and remove it.
Pull out the parking lock pawl shaft from the front side of the transmission to remove it, then remove the lock pawl and spring.
Remove the E-ring from the shaft.
Using a hammer and screwdriver, cut off the spacer and remove it from the shaft.
Using a pin punch and hammer, tap out the spring pin.

atten4.ptxt: Slowly tap out the spring pin so that it does not fall into the transmission case.

s2.ptxt: Pull out the manual valve lever shaft through the case to remove it, and remove the manual valve lever.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE MANUAL VALVE LEVER SHAFT OIL SEAL

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, pry out the 2 oil seals.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT INSTALLATION DISTANCE OF OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the transmission case.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the distance between the top of the clutch drum and SST.

atten4.ptxt: Make a note of the measurement for reference during reassembly.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE OVERDRIVE PLANETARY GEAR ASSEMBLY WITH DIRECT CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the overdrive planetary gear together with the direct clutch from the transmission case.
Remove the race and thrust washer.
Hold the overdrive direct clutch drum and be turned the input shaft. Check that the input shaft can be turned clockwise but cannot be turned counterclockwise.
Remove the overdrive direct clutch from the overdrive planetary gear.
Place the overdrive direct clutch onto the oil pump.
Using a dial indicator, measure the overdrive direct clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the result is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Remove the overdrive direct clutch from the oil pump.
Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the overdrive brake hub.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE OVERDRIVE CLUTCH FLANGE AND CUSHION PLATE

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the flange and cushion plate.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the disc and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the disc and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE OVERDRIVE CLUTCH RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the clutch return spring and compress the clutch return spring with a press.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring.
Remove the clutch return spring.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH PISTON SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place the overdrive direct clutch onto the oil pump.
Hold the overdrive direct clutch piston and apply compressed air to the oil pump to remove the overdrive direct clutch piston.
Remove the 2 O-rings from the piston.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH PISTON SUB-ASSEMBLY
INSPECT OVERDRIVE DIRECT CLUTCH DRUM SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the clutch drum bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the clutch drum.
Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Remove the No. 4 thrust washer, 1-way clutch assembly, No. 3 thrust washer and thrust bearing.
Remove the 2 retainers.
Remove the 1-way clutch from the outer race.
Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the planetary gear bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the planetary gear.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the planetary pinion gear thrust clearance.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the planetary gear thrust washer. If necessary, replace the planetary gear.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PACK CLEARANCE OF OVERDRIVE BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Place the overdrive case onto the transmission case, facing the cutout of the overdrive case downward.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that the oil hole of the overdrive case is aligned with the oil hole of the transmission case.

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the overdrive brake pack clearance by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Remove the overdrive case from the transmission case.
Remove the overdrive brake from the transmission case.

atten4.ptxt: When the overdrive brake is removed, the front clutch may adhere to it.

s2.ptxt: Remove the race and the No. 1 overdrive planetary gear thrust washer.
Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the flange, 3 discs and 3 plates.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs, plates and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, plates and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE OVERDRIVE PLANETARY RING GEAR SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the overdrive planetary ring gear.
Remove the bearing and 2 races.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE OVERDRIVE BRAKE RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the overdrive brake return spring.
Hold the overdrive brake piston by hand and apply compressed air to the passage to remove the overdrive brake piston.
Remove the 2 O-rings from the piston.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE CLUTCH DRUM OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 oil seal rings.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT INSTALLATION DISTANCE OF FRONT CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the transmission case.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the distance between the top of the clutch drum and SST.

atten4.ptxt: Make a note of the measurement for reference during reassembly.

s2.ptxt: Remove the front clutch from the transmission case.
Remove the 2 thrust bearings and race.
Place the front clutch onto the overdrive case.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR CLUTCH HUB AND FRONT CLUTCH HUB

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the rear clutch hub and front clutch hub.
Remove the thrust bearing and 2 races.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF FRONT CLUTCH PISTON

s2.ptxt: In order to check the piston stroke, install the rear clutch hub.
Install the snap ring.
Using SST and a dial indicator, measure the front clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Remove the disc.
Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the 4 plates and 3 discs.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs and plates are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs and plates.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT CLUTCH RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the spring seat and compress the return spring with a press.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring.
Remove the front clutch return spring.
Hold the front clutch piston by hand, apply compressed air to the overdrive case and remove the front clutch piston.
Remove the 2 O-rings from the piston.
Check that the check ball is free by shaking the piston.
Check that the valve does not have leaks by applying low pressure compressed air.
Remove the rear clutch from the transmission case.
Remove the race.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF REAR CLUTCH PISTON

s2.ptxt: Place the rear clutch onto the center support.
Using a dial indicator, measure the rear clutch piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the flange.
Remove the 3 discs and 3 plates.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs, plates and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, plates and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR CLUTCH RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the rear clutch return spring and compress the rear clutch return spring with a press.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring.
Remove the rear clutch return spring.
Remove the 2 bolts and 2 wave washers.

atten4.ptxt: After removing one bolt, the other will be loose.

s2.ptxt: Remove the center support from the transmission case.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE PLANETARY SUN GEAR SUB-ASSEMBLY WITH NO. 1 1-WAY CLUTCH ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring.
Remove the planetary sun gear sub-assembly with the No. 1 1-way clutch assembly.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF NO. 1 BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the brake piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the flange.
Remove the 2 discs and 3 plates.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs, plates and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, plates and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 1 BRAKE PISTON RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the spring seat and compress the return spring with a press.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring.
Remove the piston return spring.
Hold the brake piston by hand, apply compressed air to the center support to remove the brake piston.
Remove the 2 O-rings from the piston.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE CENTER SUPPORT OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Remove the 3 oil seal rings.
Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the center support bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the center support.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PISTON STROKE OF NO. 2 BRAKE PISTON

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the No. 2 brake piston stroke by applying and releasing compressed air (392 to 785 kPa (4 to 8 kgf/cm2, 57 to 114 psi)), as shown in the illustration.
If the stroke is not as specified, inspect the discs.
Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the flange.
Remove the 3 discs and 3 plates.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs, plates and flange are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, plates and flange.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 2 BRAKE PISTON RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Place SST on the spring seat and compress the return spring with a press.
Using a snap expander, remove the snap ring.
Remove the piston return spring.
Hold the brake piston by hand, apply compressed air to the center support and remove the brake piston.
Remove the O-rings from the piston and center support.
Place the clutch drum onto the center support.
Hold the clutch piston by hand, apply compressed air to the center support and remove the rear clutch piston.
Remove the 4 O-rings from the rear clutch piston.
Check that the check ball is free by shaking the piston.
Check that the valve does not have leaks by applying low-pressure compressed air.
Hold the No. 1 1-way clutch and turn the sun gear. Check that the sun gear can be turned counterclockwise but cannot be turned clockwise.
Remove the 1-way clutch from the sun gear.
Using a screwdriver, loosen the staked parts of the rear side retainer.
Remove the retainer.
Remove the 1-way clutch and 2 retainers from the outer race.
Using a pin punch and hammer, tap out the front side retainer.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE SUN GEAR SHAFT OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 oil seal rings.
Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the sun gear bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the sun gear.
Using 2 screwdrivers, remove the snap ring.
Insert 2 wires into the planetary gear and remove it.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 1 PLANETARY CARRIER THRUST WASHER

s2.ptxt: Hold the 1-way clutch and inner race and turned the planetary gear. Check that planetary gear can be turned counterclockwise but cannot be turned clockwise.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 2 1-WAY CLUTCH INNER RACE SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring.
Remove the 1-way clutch and 2 retainers from the planetary gear.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 3 PLANETARY CARRIER THRUST WASHER

s2.ptxt: Using a feeler gauge, measure the planetary pinion gear thrust clearance.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the planetary gear thrust washer. If necessary, replace the planetary gear assembly.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT PACK CLEARANCE OF NO. 3 BRAKE

s2.ptxt: Using a vernier caliper, measure the clearance between the disc and transmission case, as shown in the illustration.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the discs.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 3 BRAKE DISC SET AND NO. 3 BRAKE PRESSURE PLATE

s2.ptxt: Remove the 5 discs and 4 plates.
Remove the pressure plate.
Check whether the sliding surfaces of the discs and plates are worn or burnt.
If necessary, replace the discs, and plates.

item.ptxt: If the lining of a disc is peeled off or discolored, or if any part of the printed numbers are damaged, replace all the discs.
Before assembling new discs, soak them in ATF for at least 15 minutes.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR PLANETARY GEAR ASSEMBLY WITH INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SUB-ASSEMBLY AND OUTPUT SHAFT ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear planetary gear assembly with intermediate shaft sub-assembly and output shaft assembly from the transmission case.
Remove the bearing.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 2 PLANETARY CARRIER THRUST WASHER

s2.ptxt: Using a snap ring expander, remove the ring gear while compressing the snap ring.
Using a screwdriver, remove the snap ring from the ring gear.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR PLANETARY GEAR ASSEMBLY WITH INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the planetary gear assembly with intermediate shaft sub-assembly from the output shaft assembly.
Remove the thrust bearing and race.
Using a caliper gauge, measure the inside diameter of the output shaft bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the output shaft.
Using a feeler gauge, measure the planetary pinion gear thrust clearance.
If the clearance is not as specified, inspect the planetary gear thrust washer. If necessary, replace the planetary gear assembly.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR PLANETARY RING GEAR SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the set ring.
Remove the ring gear.
Remove the bearing from the ring gear.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SLEEVE OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the oil seal ring.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE PLANETARY OUTPUT SHAFT OIL SEAL RING

s2.ptxt: Remove the oil seal ring.
Remove the brake apply tube.
Remove the race from the transmission case.
Check that the No. 3 brake pistons move smoothly when applying and releasing compressed air from the transmission case.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 3 BRAKE PISTON RETURN SPRING SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Set SST on the spring seat and compress the return spring.
Using a snap ring expander, remove the snap ring.
Remove the brake return spring.
Hold the outer piston by hand, apply compressed air to the transmission case and remove the outer piston.
If the piston does not pop out with compressed air, lift the piston out with needle-nose pliers.
Remove the O-ring from the outer piston.
Insert SST behind the sleeve and gradually lift it out of the transmission case to remove it.
Remove the 2 O-rings from the sleeve.
Insert SST behind the inner piston and gradually lift it out of the transmission case to remove it.
Remove the 2 O-rings from the brake piston.
Using a cylinder gauge, measure the inside diameter of the transmission bush.
If the inside diameter is greater than the maximum, replace the transmission case.
